sections.instructions: Answer All Questions. Each question carries 2 Marks

sub_questions.text: Which of the following outcome is odd man out in the below list?
Point out the wrong statement.

options.A: Regression through the origin yields an equivalent slope if you center the data first
options.B: Normalizing variables results in the slope being the correlation
options.C: Least squares is not an estimation tool

sub_questions.text: Which of the following implies no relationship with respect to correlation?
Residual plots investigate normality of the errors.
Which of the following is the correct formula for total variation?

options.A: Total Variation = Residual Variation — Regression Variation
options.B: Total Variation = Residual Variation + Regression Variation
options.C: Total Variation = Residual Variation * Regression Variation

sub_questions.text: Which of the following is required by K-means clustering?

options.C: initial guess as to cluster centroids

sub_questions.text: Minimizing the likelihood is the same as maximizing -2 log likelihood.
Let us say that we have computed the gradient of our cost function and stored it in a vector g. What is the cost of one gradient descent update given the gradient?

Consider a linear-regression model with N = 3 and D = 1 with input-ouput pairs as follows: y1 = 22, X1= 1, y2 = 3, X2 = 1, y3 = 3, X3 = 2. What is the gradient of mean-square error (MSE) with respect to B1 when Bo = 0 and £1 = 1? Give your answer correct to two decimal digits.
Gradient of a continuous and differentiable function

options.C: decreases as you get closer to the minimum

sub_questions.text: Which of the following sentence is FALSE regarding regression?

options.C: It may be used for interpretation.

sub_questions.text: For the one-parameter model, mean-Square error (MSE) _ is defined as follows: = rn - Bo)?). We have a half term in the front because,

options.A: scaling MSE by half makes gradient descent converge faster.
options.B: presence of half makes it easy to do grid search.
options.C: it does not matter whether half is there or not.

sub_questions.text: Lasso can be interpreted as least-squares linear regression where

options.A: weights are regularized with the L1 norm
options.B: weights are regularized with the L2 norm
options.C: the weights have a Gaussian prior

sub_questions.text: Regarding bias and variance, which of the following statements are true? (Here ‘high’ and ‘low’ are relative to the ideal model.)

options.A: Models which overfit have a high bias.
options.B: Models which overfit have a low bias.
options.C: Models which underfit have a high variance.

sub_questions.text: In K-fold cross-validation, K is
The second principal (PC2) component is to the first principal component (PC1)
What is the cosine similarity between _[4, 3, 3, 5], and__[2, 0, 0, o]?
Find the odd out from the following list: Genetic Algorithm (GA), Particle Swarm Optimization (PSO), Stochastic Gradient Descent (SGD), and Gravitational Search Algorithm (GSA).
What is the cosine similarity between [5,2,0,5],and [2,0,0, o]
The Manhattan distance between two points (10, 10) and (30,30) is:

Suppose we train a hard-margin linear SVM on n > 100 data points in , yielding a hyperplane with exactly 2 support vectors. If we add one more data point and retrain the classifier, what is the maximum possible number of support vectors for the new hyperplane (assuming the n + 1 points are linearly separable)?
A valid Kernel function follows condition.
In Soft-margin Support Vector Classifier, the variable allows few instances within the margin.
multipliers used to integrate the inequality constraints into the main objective function.
Neural networks

options.B: can be used for regression as well as classification

sub_questions.text: Sigmoidal activation function maps the neuron output between

A single input and output nuron has an input of 2, a weight of 6 and a bias of -5.5. What will be the output if the activation function is bipolar sigmoid (where, slope s=0.6 and round off 4 decimal places)
In a multi-layer neural network, the term “multi” suggests

options.A: Only one hidden layer in between input and output layers
options.B: One or more hidden layer(s) in between input and output layers
options.C: Always more than one hidden layers in between input and output layers

sections.instructions: Answer Any Three Questions. Each Question carries 12 Marks

sub_questions.label: A
sub_questions.text: Why do we call Naive Bayes classifier “Naive”? State its advantages and disadvantages.

sub_questions.label: B
sub_questions.text: Explain the following with examples: One-Against-All (OAA) and One-Against-One (OAO).

sub_questions.label: C
sub_questions.text: Derive the Naive Bayes classification algorithm using the following toy dataset. Classify a “Red SUV Domestic” using Naive Bayes Classifier. (Dataset provided)

sub_questions.label: A
sub_questions.text: What is slack variable and its role in soft-margin SVM classifier? Explain the concept using suitable diagram.

sub_questions.label: B
sub_questions.text: Find the entropy, information gain and draw the decision trees for the following set of training dataset. (Dataset provided)

sub_questions.label: C
sub_questions.text: Explain the following terms with examples: Confusion Matrix, Accuracy, Precision, Recall, Fi-score and Area Under the Curve (AUC).

sub_questions.label: A
sub_questions.text: Explain the following with examples: One-Against-All (OAA) and One-Against-One (OAO).

sub_questions.label: B
sub_questions.text: States the Mercers conditions for a valid kernel function. Name at least four valid kernel functions used in SVM classifier with appropriate equations.

sub_questions.label: C
sub_questions.text: The merits and demerits of the SVM classifier.

sub_questions.label: A
sub_questions.text: What is “curse of dimensionality”? State the possible remedies.

sub_questions.label: B
sub_questions.text: What is a Covariance Matrix? State its limitation.

sub_questions.label: C
sub_questions.text: Using PCA, reduce the Dimension of the given data from 2 to 1. (Dataset provided)

sub_questions.label: A
sub_questions.text: Differentiate between lossy and lossless feature/attribute reduction with suitable examples.

sub_questions.label: B
sub_questions.text: What is a Covariance Matrix? State its limitation.

sub_questions.label: C
sub_questions.text: Explain the Principal Component Analysis (PCA) and reduce the following dataset step-by-step from 2 dimensions to 1. (Dataset provided)

sub_questions.label: A
sub_questions.text: Differentiate between lossy and lossless feature/attribute reduction with suitable examples.

sub_questions.label: B
sub_questions.text: What is a principal component? Explain the (mathematical) relationship between the first and the second principal components.

sub_questions.label: C
sub_questions.text: Using PCA, reduce the Dimension of the given data from 2 to 1. (Dataset provided)

sub_questions.label: A
sub_questions.text: What are over-fitting and under-fitting? Explain them with suitable examples.

sub_questions.label: B
sub_questions.text: Explain the Elbow technique to determine sn appropriate “K” value in K-NN classifier.

sub_questions.label: C
sub_questions.text: What are the intra-cluster and inter-cluster distances? Using K-means Clustering Algorithm, cluster the following data points: P1=(75,102), P2=(201,16), P3=(68, 80), P4=(188,36), P5=(165,55) and P6=(100,42). where, K=2, and use Euclidean distance for the purpose. (start the computation with P2 and P3 as the two initial centroids points)

sub_questions.label: A
sub_questions.text: What is the significance of bias in the decision boundary? Explain the Bias-Variance relationship in machine learning with suitable diagrams.

sub_questions.label: B
sub_questions.text: Why does we use the term “regression” in the Logistic Regression classification algorithm.

sub_questions.label: C
sub_questions.text: Using KNN algorithm and the given data set, predict the class label of the test data point (16,8), where K=3 and Euclidean distance. (Dataset provided)

sub_questions.label: A
sub_questions.text: What are the over-fitting and the under-fitting? Explain them with suitable examples.

sub_questions.label: B
sub_questions.text: What are the intra-cluster and inter-cluster distances? Explain the Elbow technique to determine an appropriate “K” value in K-NN classifier.

sub_questions.label: C
sub_questions.text: Using K-means Clustering Algorithm, cluster the following data points: P1=(75,102), P2=(201,16), P3=(68, 80), P4=(188,36), P5=(165,55) and P6=(100,42). where, K=2, and use Euclidean distance for the purpose. (start the computation with P1 and P3 as the two initial centroids points)

sub_questions.label: A
sub_questions.text: What is Binary Activated Neuron model? States its limitations.

sub_questions.label: B
sub_questions.text: A two input single output neuron model has weights value [1.5 -2.1] and bias of -3. It is given an input [2.0 2.5]. What will be the output if the binary step function threshold=1 is used?

sub_questions.label: C
sub_questions.text: Describe Multi-layer Perceptron Neural Network with suitable mathematical expressions and diagram.

sub_questions.label: A
sub_questions.text: What is perceptron? Explain it with an example.

sub_questions.label: B
sub_questions.text: Differentiate between linearly and non-linearly separable datasets.

sub_questions.label: C
sub_questions.text: Solve XOR problem with a two input artificial neuron model.

sub_questions.label: A
sub_questions.text: What are the learning rate and the momentum in Artificial Neural Network (ANN) model? State different learning rules used in ANN.

sub_questions.label: B
sub_questions.text: Draw a diagram of a multiple input single output artificial neural network and compute its input-output relationship.

sub_questions.label: C
sub_questions.text: Describe the Backpropagation algorithm using appropriate mathematical expressions.

instructions: Question paper consists of four SECTIONS i.e. A, B, C and D.
Attempt minimum one question each from Sections B, C, D.
The figures in the margin indicate full marks.
Candidates are required to give their answers in their own words as far as practicable and all parts of a question should be answered at one place only.

questions.text: Sketch the basic block diagram of a learning machine.
The Manhattan distance between two points (10, 10) and (30,30) is:
K-Nearest Neighbor is a . algorithm.
Give an example scenario where a multiple linear regression model is necessary.
State the difference between Generalized Linear Model and Linear model?
What should you do when your model is suffering from low bias and high variance?
How do you initialize weights in a neural network?
In a binary classification problem, out of 30 data points 12 belong to class I and 18 belong to class II. What is the entropy of the data set?
Which of the following algorithms is not an ensemble learning algorithm?
Explain the phrase “Curse of Dimensionality”.

sub_questions.text: Explain L1 and L2 regularization with detailed mathematical equations and explain its importance.

sub_questions.label: a
sub_questions.text: Discuss the following terms with examples: Confusion Matrix, Accuracy, Precision, Recall. Suppose I have 10,000 emails in my mailbox out of which 200 are spams. The spam detection system detects 150 mails as spams, out of which 50 are actually spams. What is the precision and recall of my spam detection system?

sub_questions.label: b

sub_questions.text: Write Short notes on I. Bagging IL. Boosting III. Random Forests IV. Adaboost

sub_questions.text: Why is SVM more accurate than Logistic regression? Plot a hyper plane for the given data set (1,-1) (2,-1) (4,0) (5,1) (5,-1) (6,0) by using SVM.

sub_questions.label: b
sub_questions.text: State the characteristics of an artificial neural network. Construct a feed-forward network with five input nodes, three hidden nodes and four output nodes with necessary mathematical expressions and explanations.

sub_questions.label: a
sub_questions.text: Consider the following set of training examples: (Dataset provided) I. What is the entropy of this collection of training examples with respect to the target function classification? Il. What is the information gain of a2 relative to these training examples? III. Draw decision tree for the given data set.

sub_questions.label: b
sub_questions.text: Implement AND function using McCulloch-Pitts neuron (take binary data). Consider the below given truth table for AND function. (Truth table provided)

questions.text: In ML trade-off between over- fitting and under- fitting is always done to get optimal fit models. In the context of ANN this trade off is affected by some structural assumption of ANN. Which one of the following can most affect the trade-off in ANN.

options.D: The use of a constant-term unit input

questions.text: We know from the decision —tree learning that whenever the attributes are real-valued we usually prefer to split them into binary buckets taking some threshold value. However, one of your friend advised you to adopt multiway split. From the options given below what you think would be the single biggest problem if you follow his advice.

options.B: Final decision tree would do badly on training and testing data
options.C: Final decision tree will do better with training data but will fair bad with testing data
options.D: Final decision tree will do better with testing data but will fair bad with training data.

questions.text: P(Blockbuster Movie | Includes Will Smith) = 0.01 P(Blockbuster Movie |Will Smith absent) = 0.1 P(Will Smith in a randomly chosen movie) = 0.01 What is P(Will Smith is in the movie | Not a Blockbuster Movie)?
It is found that we cannot find the value y that satisfy the below two equations simultaneously. Find the value of y using least square errors. 4y=6 8y=2
Select the statement what is false for K-NN algorithm.

options.A: The variance usually increases as K increases.
options.B: K-NN can be used for classification as well as regression.
options.C: The bias usually increases as K increases.
options.D: The larger the value of K, smoother the decision boundary.

questions.text: Select the true statement about PCA.

options.A: The principal components that explain the lowest variance are selected last.
options.B: It does not require standardized data.
options.C: Principal components need not be orthogonal to each other.
options.D: It can be used to transform data into higher dimensions.

questions.text: Linearly inseparable problems are solved using neural networks because,

options.A: they are the class of problem that if continuous and bounded can be approximated by a multilayer perceptron
options.B: they are the class of problem that neural networks with linear activation functions can solve
options.C: they are the only class of problem that neural networks can solve successfully
options.D: they are the class of problem that can be solved by single layer perceptron

questions.text: In ML trade-off between over- fitting and under- fitting is always done to get optimal fit models. In the context of polynomial regression this trade off is affected by some structural assumption of regression. Which one of the following can most affect the trade-off in polynomial regression?

options.b: Whether we learn the weights by matrix inversion or gradient descent
options.c: The assumed variance of the Gaussian noise
options.d: The use of a constant-term unit input

questions.text: Splitting in Decision Tree aim to decrease the model complexity
For two Boolean random variables, X and Y, if P(X) = %, P(Y) = 1/3, and P(X | ~Y) = %, what is P(X | Y)?
“R squared “is used to measure the goodness-fit of a linear regression. What from the following is true if a new feature is added and the model is retained as before?

options.a: If R squared increases this feature is significant
options.b: If R squared decreases this feature is not significant
options.c: R squared cannot give any idea about the significance of the feature

questions.text: Which of the following will be true about k in k-NN in terms of Bias?

options.a: When you increase the k the bias will be increases.
options.b: When you decrease the k the bias will be increases.

questions.text: The Principal Components obtained are Linear Combination of the Original Features

questions.text: In ML trade-off between over- fitting and under- fitting is always done to get optimal fit models. In the context of Gaussian Bayes classifier this trade off is affected by some structural assumption of Gaussian Bayes classifier. Which one of the following can most affect the trade-off in polynomial regression.

options.a: Whether we learn the class centers by Maximum Likelihood or Gradient Descent
options.b: Whether we assume full class covariance matrices or diagonal class covariance matrices
options.c: Whether we have equal class priors or priors estimated from the data.
options.d: Whether we allow classes to have different mean vectors or we force them to share the same mean vector

questions.text: Splitting in Decision Tree aim to reduce the variance in the Decision Tree Model
We know that Classification is a special case of regression. So, in this context is it correct to say that logistic regression is also a class of linear regression.

options.c: Insufficient data to answer this question

questions.text: One ML engineer has developed a polynomial regression with degree 4 which is perfect fit to the data. Now he has following situations: i. Simple Linear regression will have high bias and low variance ii. Simple Linear regression will low high bias and high variance iii. Polynomial regression with degree 4 will have low bias and high variance iv. Polynomial regression with degree 4 will have low bias and low variance Which of the following options will be true?

Which of the following statement is true about k-NN algorithm? (i) k-NN performs much better if all of the data have the same scale (ii) k-NN works well with a small number of input variables (p), but struggles when the number of inputs is very large (iii) k-NN makes no assumptions about the functional form of the problem being solved

options.a: The functions is continuous and symmetric
options.b: The function is positive semi- definite
options.c: The function has only non-negative Eigen values
